### Welcome to Nodecast agent worker.

NCW is an agent which is connected to [NCS](http://nodecast.github.com/ncs/). It is using Zeromq to communicatig and to monitoring.

NCW fork your worker, so it send to STDIN the payloads received from NCS, also it catch the worker's response to STDOUT and send it to NCS.

### USAGE

NCW needs some steps before using.

1. create a node. A node can identify the host where yours payloads come from. You should create a node for each physical or virtual server.

...
$ curl -H "X-nodename: your-node-name" --user "email:token" http://ncs-ip:4567/node/create
...

curl return a node uuid :

...
{"node_password":"e6cc13a3-1236-46cb-b40f-a66650ab5eef","node_uuid":"2d0a7780-e8fe-4e0a-89c6-a5a2737b095a"}
...

2. create a workflow. Nodecast need a workflow before scheduling your task.

...
curl -H "X-workflow: test" -d '{ "worker1": 1, "worker2": 2 }' --user "user@email.com:token" http://127.0.0.1:4567/workflow/create
...

return a workflow uuid : 

...
{"uuid":"0ebcdab6-0263-42d3-be7d-9602fa15f68c"}
...


### LAUNCH
Now your can launch NCW with your node uuid and your workflow uuid

```
$ ncw --ncs-ip=127.0.0.1 --ncs-port=5569 --node-uuid=your-node-uuid --node-password=your-node-password --worker-type=service --worker-name="bttrack" --exec="yourworker.bin"
```
